III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal History check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/22/2023, Youth woke up with drainage, itching, and burning
in her vagina. She had a hickey/bruise on her left breast. The
night prior 9/21/23, Youth had an interaction with Staff where he
touched her legs and made her feel uncomfortable. Youth
believes Staff sexually assaulted her while she was sleeping on
9/27/23.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was contacted via telephone on October 4, 2023.
Complainant did not have any additional information.
Youth A was forensically interviewed face-to-face in the
hospital on September 28, 2023, by Delta County Child
Assessment Center. The interview was viewed on October 3,
2023. Youth A said she is placed at Bay Pines Center however
currently in the hospital for self-harm. Youth A stated that Staff 1
was in the hallway, however, was reassured that Staff 1 was not
at the hospital. Youth A said on Friday, September 22, 2023, Staff
1 put his legs on her and then on her chair which made her feel
uncomfortable and she pushed his legs off her chair. Youth A said
Staff 1 continued to stare at her and smile, so she got up and went
to sit by an outlet and tied her sweatshirt around her neck. Youth
A said Staff 1 attempted to untie it, but she was very upset that he
tried to touch her, so he called for help and a female staff arrived
and took over and got the sweatshirt from around her neck. Youth
A said she was alone with Staff 1 on the pod during this incident
and did not tell anyone about feeling uncomfortable because she
“does not know staff that well” and does not trust them. Youth A
said she was placed on suicide watch and placed in a safety
gown. Youth A said she took her night medications which included
trazadone for sleeping and went to bed at 8:30pm. Youth A said
when she woke up on Saturday, September 23, 2023, she had a
mark on her chest and burning and itching in her vagina. Youth A
said she thinks Staff 1 did something sexual to her while she was
sleeping because that was how she felt the last time she was
raped. Youth A said upon waking up she got dressed under staff
supervision due to her being on suicide watch and then went onto
the pod to listen to music and “chill”. Youth A said she showed
Staff 3 the mark on her chest but did not disclose where she
thought it came from and Staff 3 did not ask her additional
questions regarding the mark. Youth A said she was “watching”
2

Staff 1 all day on Saturday and when Staff 3 noticed and asked
Youth A why she was watching Staff 1, Youth A said she told Staff
3 “he makes me feel uncomfortable”, and when asked why she
replied, “he just does”. Youth A said she did not tell anyone at Bay
Pines Center that she thought Staff 1 raped her because after her
last rapist threatened to kill her she was unsure of what Staff 1
would do if she reported it. Youth A said she sleeps in a bedroom
alone with no roommates. Youth A said she went to the hospital
on September 27, 2023, and reported her concerns to the hospital
doctors and staff. Youth A said Staff 1 has never done anything
prior to this incident. Youth A said no other staff has ever done
anything to her prior to this incident.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 3, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth B said she was placed on girls pod 2 with Youth A. Youth B
said Youth A would self-harm often by biting herself on her arms
and shoulders when staff were not looking. Youth B said Youth A
recently bit herself so badly she went to the hospital. Youth B said
Youth A got along with most of the staff however had “bad
boundaries” with the male staff. Youth B said Youth A would say
inappropriate things to the male staff, and “act grown” in front of
them. Youth B said Youth A told her she “likes” Staff 1 because he
“looked like a neighbor from her past she had sex with”. Youth B
said she was placed with Youth A at a previous facility and Youth
A will lie about staff and say things they do which never
happened. Youth B said Youth A accused two different staff of
touching her inappropriately at their prior placement which was not
true. Youth B said she has never seen a male staff in Youth A’s
room. Youth B said she has never seen a male staff act or say
anything inappropriate to Youth A.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 3, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C
said she was placed on the same pod as Youth A prior to her
being hospitalized. Youth C said Youth A was “not safe” and
would bite her arms, place objects in her rectum to make it bleed,
and act out “for attention”. Youth C said she never directly
witnessed Youth A placing items in her rectum but rather heard
from Youth A that she was bleeding, and another peer told her it
was because Youth A places things in her rectum. Youth C said
she never saw Youth A biting herself however would see Youth
A’s arms and shoulders with severe bite marks, bleeding, and
bruising. Youth C said Youth A would bite her arms so severely
that the tendons were visible. Youth C said Youth A also
threatened to “drown herself in her toilet” and staff had to turn off
3

her water to her room and only turn it on when they were watching
her. Youth C said Youth A would often accuse people of doing
things that were not true, stating this would be people in her past,
current staff, and other youth. Youth C said recently Youth A had
accused Staff 2 of touching her on her buttock however it was not
true. Youth C said Youth A has also accused people in her past of
rape but then admitted she also wanted to have sex with them.
Youth C said Youth A “acts inappropriate” around male staff,
giving examples of Youth A “pulling her pants really high” and
“switching” when walking near male staff. Youth C said Youth A
told her she “likes” Staff 1 because he reminded her of a neighbor,
she had sex with in her past. Youth C said Staff 1 is not on the
pod often as he is a float staff. Youth C said she has no
knowledge of Youth A and Staff 1 ever being alone together.
Youth C said she has never seen any staff enter Youth A’s room
alone. Youth C said Youth A has told her that she likes to go to
the hospital because she gets a lot of attention and the staff at the
hospital “take care” of her.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on October
3, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said
he is a youth specialist and has been employed for three months.
Staff 1 said he “floats” and so is not assigned to a specific pod and
will help out wherever the supervisor assigns him that shift. Staff 1
said he has worked with Youth A’s pod over the past three
months, and more frequently within the last few weeks. Staff 1
said he has only worked day shifts and has never worked an
overnight shift. Staff 1 said he has worked with Youth A in a group
setting and was assigned to be her one-to-one staff while she was
on suicide watch. Staff 1 said Youth A seems like an “awkward
youth” and will just “stare at him blankly”. Staff 1 said when he
was Youth A’s one-to-one staff he was sitting in the pod and put
his feet on the back of her chair while she was sitting in it and was
talking to her. Staff 1 said he did not think anything about it and
Youth A never said it made her feel uncomfortable. Staff 1 said he
has never gone into Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 1 said he and
another staff were sent to the hospital while Youth A and another
youth were admitted to sit in the hallway outside their rooms. Staff
1 said he was only at the hospital for about thirty minutes and then
was sent back to the facility. Staff 1 said he never saw Youth A
when he was at the hospital. Staff 1 said he has never touched
Youth A and denied ever being sexual with her in any manner.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on October
3, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said
she is a youth specialist and assigned to Youth A’s group. Staff 2
4

said she has worked with Staff 1 a few different times. Staff 2 said
she has never seen Staff 1 being inappropriate with Youth A. Staff
2 said Youth A has never disclosed any concerns about Staff 1.
Staff 2 said Youth A made accusations against her recently saying
that she “grabbed [Youth A] butt” when Youth A was walking
inside from being outdoors. Staff 2 said when Youth A said this
the other youth confronted her for lying and Youth A admitted she
was being dishonest. Staff 2 said she is not aware of Youth A
making any other allegations against staff.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on October 5, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 3 said she has
been a youth specialist for about four months and during that time
has had ongoing interactions with Youth A. Staff 3 said on
September 23, 2023, she supervised a visit between Youth A and
her grandparents. Staff 3 said during the visit she talked openly
about her self-harming issues with her grandparents but never
mentioned concerns about any staff member. Staff 3 said after the
visit had finished Youth A told her that had one mark on her chest
that she was unsure how she got it. Staff 3 said Youth A showed
her the mark and it looked like a “bruise or hickey on the left side
of her chest”. Staff 3 said it was in a spot that Youth A would have
been able to reach with her own mouth and looked like all the
other marks on her arms and shoulders. Staff 3 said Youth A
never accused anyone of making the mark on her chest and never
disclosed any concerns about it coming from a staff member. Staff
3 said she did not document or do anything about the mark as it
was like all the other marks that the staff had been monitoring due
to Youth A’s self-harm. Staff 3 said Youth A has been self-harming
by biting her arms and shoulders as well as putting her fingers or
objects in her rectum which has caused it to bleed. Staff 3 said
Youth A has had medical attention for her self-harming, stating
she brought her to the hospital on September 27, 2023, for
medical attention. Staff 3 said Youth A has had poor boundaries
with male staff, stating Youth A will get very close to them, try to
touch them, baby talk in front or to them, and act out when they
are around to get their attention. Staff 3 said she has not seen any
interactions between Youth A and Staff 1 specifically.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
October 3, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Therapist said she is Youth A’s primary therapist and has been
since her placement at Bay Pines Center. Therapist said Youth A
has significant trauma from her past including finding her younger
brother deceased for which she blames herself for not finding him
earlier to save his life. Therapist said she is using cognitive
5

processing therapy with Youth A, and she does very well during
sessions being able to recognize her strengths and needs
however does not take the tools provided in therapy and utilize
them throughout the day on the unit. Therapist said when Youth A
came to Bay Pines Center, she had seizures that may or may not
have actually been real and has at times admitted to “faking”
them. Therapist said after a period of time Youth A no longer had
seizures but then began to have rectal bleeding which she was
brought to the hospital for treatment. Therapist said the hospital
treated Youth A for her rectal bleeding, noting nothing was in her
rectum, and then was sent back to Bay Pines Center which made
Youth A very mad as she thought she would be sent somewhere
else. Therapist said the rectal bleeding has been less frequent
and now Youth A is biting her arms, shoulders, and lips. Therapist
said some of the bite wounds Youth A is inflicting on herself are so
significant they are exposing her tendons. Therapist said Youth A
has a safety plan however will not bite herself in front of staff but
rather show staff once she has caused the injury. Therapist said
Youth A has told her she does not want to be at Bay Pines Center
however really does not know where she wants to go. Therapist
said Youth A has never spoke negatively about staff or disclosed
any concerns about staff to her. Therapist said Staff 1 was
recently assigned to help on Youth A’s pod and therefore Youth A
has no rapport or bond to him. Therapist said Youth A has made
allegations one other time that were deemed untrue regarding
Staff 2. Therapist said she was recently made aware that Youth A
has previously made allegations at other placements.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on October
3, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Nurse said
they are contracted by Office of St. Francis to work at Bay Pines
three days a week. Nurse said she has seen Youth A on several
occasions for rectum bleeding, bite wounds, and seizures. Nurse
said Youth A came to Bay Pines Center having seizures which
appear to be psychologically induced, and at times Youth A would
fake seizures for attention. Nurse said Youth A has medication
and receives medical treatment for her seizures. Nurse said Youth
A was seen for rectal bleeding therefore sent to the office for a full
medical workup including colonoscopy and all tests came back
normal. Nurse said during the exams Youth A admitted to putting
objects in her rectum and putting her fingers in her rectum and
“picking” which was causing the bleeding. Nurse said Youth A
continues this behavior which has led to her having Proctitis,
inflammation of the lining of the rectum. Nurse said Youth A has
recently been seen multiple times for her bite wounds on her arms
and shoulders. Nurse said Youth A is biting her arms so deeply
6

that she has exposed tendons. Nurse said Youth A is on
antibiotics for her wounds as she continues to bite the same
wound causing infection. Nurse said Youth A reported she is biting
because she does not want to live or be at Bay Pines Center.
Nurse said she is very concerned that Youth A will bite through a
vein or develop sepsis from her wounds if she continues to bite
the same area and not allow them to heal correctly. Nurse denied
Youth A ever disclosing any concerns about staff. Nurse said
Youth A has never complained of any vaginal issues such as
itching or discharge. Nurse said she reviewed the most recent
hospital records for Youth A and there was no evidence of vaginal
trauma. Nurse said she does not make safety plans for youth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 has one disciplinary action
dated August 30, 2023, for being late for work.
• Youth A’s medical records from September 11, 2023,
September 16, 2023, September 19, 2023, September 21,
2023, September 26, 2023, September 27, 2023, and
October 3, 2023. The medical notes report the self-injury
behaviors of Youth A and treatment for her bite wounds.
The medical notes report an exam due to Youth A’s
disclosure of sexual abuse, noting a SANE exam was not
completed however the pelvic exam did not note anything
abnormal. The medical reports indicate that Youth A was
seen by Pathways during each hospital visit in order to
evaluate her mental health needs.
• Youth A’s safety plan dated September 12, 2023. The
safety plan included a description of behaviors to monitor
for Youth A, safe measures or coping skills for Youth A to
utilize when struggling with intrusive thoughts, and staff
measures to be used in working with and monitoring Youth
A to ensure safety.
• Youth A’s Updated Treatment Plan dated August 9, 2023.
The treatment plan notes Youth A’s self-harm behaviors
and ongoing issues with her emotional stability and lack of
coping skills.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of September 21, 2023, Youth A’s pod was
reviewed on October 23, 2023. Staff 1 and Youth A are seen on
the pod with no other youth or staff. Staff 1 is sitting in the staff
chair that is an office chair on wheels. Youth A is sitting on the
arm of her large plastic chair. Staff 1 is seen placing his feet on
the chair Youth A is sitting in on four occasions however does not
place his feet physically on Youth A at any time. Staff 1 and Youth
7

A are engaging in conversation and watching television. There
was nothing of concern in the video footage.
Video footage of September 21, 2023, overnight into
September 22, 2023 of Youth A’s pod was reviewed on
October 3, 2023. Staff 1 is not working on that pod throughout the
entire overnight shift. No staff is seen opening or going into Youth
A’s room throughout the entire shift. Staff are seen conducting bed
checks as required through the bedroom window.
The facility is found in compliance with staff qualifications. There is
no evidence that Staff 1 sexually assaulted Youth A or engaged in
any inappropriate behaviors with her.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
